description: From Middle English mishap, myshappe, myssehappe, equivalent to mis- +‎ hap.

examples: Since the mishap with the banana peel, he watches his step.

entries.meaning: Evil accident; ill luck; misfortune; mischance.

description: From Middle English mishappen, equivalent to mis- +‎ hap.

verbs.description: mishap (third-person singular simple present mishaps, present participle mishapping, simple past and past participle mishapped)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To happen through misfortune; to mishappen.
